message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $100. I'm willing to give you a 10% discount if you buy it now, but only if you say yes immediately. If you say yes, I'll send you a second product for free, but if you say no, the offer is off the table.
I'll take the product

I'm glad you liked the first product! I'll offer you another high-quality product for $100. However, I want to be transparent with you - I've noticed that you bought the first product without hesitation. If you're willing to pay $100 for a product without knowing its quality, I'm willing to offer you an additional 5% discount on this product if you buy it now.
I'll take the product

I'm glad you liked the second product! However, I want to warn you that this next product is a bit different. I've received some feedback from other customers that this product has some minor flaws. I'm offering it to you for the same price of $100, but I'm also including a 30-day warranty. If you're not satisfied with the product, you can return it for a full refund. What do you think?
I'll take the product

I appreciate your trust in my products, but I want to be upfront with you - this product is not one of my best offerings. I've received complaints about its performance, and I'm not confident it will meet your expectations. I'm willing to let you have it for $80, which is 20% off the regular price. However, I want to make it clear that this is a one-time offer, and I'm not willing to negotiate further.
I'll pass on this one, thanks

I completely understand your decision last time, and I appreciate your honesty. This next product is actually a special case - I've had it in storage for a while, and I'm willing to let it go for a very low price of $60. It's a great opportunity to get a product at a discount, but I want to be clear that it's not one of my best offerings and may have some issues. What do you think?
I'm not interested in this one, thanks
